intro: Chaenostoma glabratum, commonly known as the smooth chaenostoma, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Violaceae, which includes violets and related species. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, violet-blue flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
